IM SOO PISSED OFF
But well,,
Holland4life!

item.title: Noooooooo holland! lsot
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:19, topic:348467”]If Rob Green didn’t make that stupid mistake against USA…

England would have played Ghana and beat them…
England then would have beaten Uruguay…
England then would beat Netherlands to advance to the final…
The Spanish would then get scared of England’s amazingness and loose to Germany…
England would then play Germany in the World Cup Final without an incompetent referee , everyone would get 9999 excited and say lets do another 1966…
England would the beat Germany 3-0…
USA would then say they won…
USA then would threaten England with an atomic bomb…
USA would then try to blow up England but pull a Columbus and drop the bomb on India…
Osama Bin Laden would rage and use his weapons of mass destruction from his cave and blow the whole of the USA up and England would get a second star on their football shirt![/quote]

epic. rep++

Read full topic

item.title: Noooooooo holland! lsot
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:27, topic:348467”][quote author=mark033 link=topic=444845.msg3266455#msg3266455 date=1278891532]
Robben should’ve scored two, Villa should’ve scored one, Xavi should have got at least one of those free kicks on target, Heitinga shouldn’t have been sent off and Iniesta probably should’ve been (stimulation+ripping his jersey off).

It was a poor excuse for a football match, let alone a World Cup Final. Neither team deserved to win and in the end the idiot referee (he’s English, go figure) handed Spain the game.

I sincerely hope that it goes down in history as one of the most boring World Cup Grand Finals ever. In that regard, I guess Spain did deserve to win.
[/quote]So what if his english??[/quote]

So he does what English players try to do at major tournaments, he tries to treat it like a Premier League game. Before he took the final he’d given out something like the second highest average of yellow cards. There’s a reason for that; and it’s not because he got all the dirty games. Given a game like that, one that already threatened to be dour, defensive and cagey, to a referee who gives out that many bookings was an accident waiting to happen. And it did, congratulations Fifa.

FYI I’m not talking about the error pertaining to the supposed corner (yes it was, but that doesn’t change the game) I’m talking about Howard Webb’s inane booking policy that cost the Netherlands a player who really shouldn’t have been sent off.

Read full topic

item.title: Noooooooo holland! lsot
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

The Netherlands made two finals in a row in '74/'78, they’ve made the semi-finals once since then and I’m pretty sure they’ve also played quarters as well (going out to South Korea on penalties in '02 I think).

Out of those two teams Spain had less of a World Cup legacy before last night.

Read full topic

item.title: Noooooooo holland! lsot
item.dc:creator: @mark033 mark033
item.description:
@mark033 wrote:

Robben should’ve scored two, Villa should’ve scored one, Xavi should have got at least one of those free kicks on target, Heitinga shouldn’t have been sent off and Iniesta probably should’ve been (stimulation+ripping his jersey off).

It was a poor excuse for a football match, let alone a World Cup Final. Neither team deserved to win and in the end the idiot referee (he’s English, go figure) handed Spain the game.

I sincerely hope that it goes down in history as one of the most boring World Cup Grand Finals ever. In that regard, I guess Spain did deserve to win.
